snippet: There is a growing confidence that institutions in countries like Germany will succeed in their efforts to support the euro.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column says that for much of 2012, fate of Europe's banks appeared to be a critical issue, but since the European Central Bank took steps to assure that banks could borrow money, and it became clear that Germany was not willing to allow the euro zone to break up, region's bank stocks have been among the best investments worldwide.
lead_paragraph: There is a growing confidence that institutions in countries like Germany will succeed in their efforts to support the euro.
